chapter.title: Installing &sap; Applications
chapter.para: This section guides you through the installation of &sap; media sets you received from &sap;.

listitem.para: If you are installing an &sap; application within the installation workflow, continue with .
If you are installing an &sap; application within an installed system, continue with .

sect1.title: Products That Can Be Installed Using &sapwiz;
sect1.para: Using the &sapwiz;, you can install stand-alone &hana; database instances. Additionally, the following &sap; products (along with a database) can be installed using the &sapwiz;:

important.title: Installation of Oracle Databases Not Possible
important.para: The &sapwiz; does not allow installing products together with Oracle databases. To install an Oracle database, install the base product &sls; first, then install the Oracle database and later convert your installation to &s4sa;. This is necessary because the installer of Oracle databases queries for the existence of certain files, not all of which are included in a &s4sa; installation.
For more information about converting, see .

sect1.title: First Steps
sect1.para: These first steps are only relevant during the installation workflow.

step.para: When the system is booted, it displays the screen Welcome. Proceed with Next.
The screen Network Settings will now open. This gives you an opportunity to change the network settings.
When you are finished configuring networking, proceed with Next.

important.title: Configure Networking as Recommended by &sap;
important.para: Make sure to configure the network connection according to the documentation of your &sap; application.

step.para:
For information about configuring networking, see
&admin;, Chapter Basic Networking, Section Configuring a Network Connection with YaST (&docaddress;).
(While the next screen loads, the Welcome screen may appear again for a few seconds.)

step.para: Choose one of the following options:

term.guimenu: Create SAP file systems and start SAP product installation

listitem.para: Allows installing an &sap; application and setting up the system as a server providing &sap; installation routines to other systems.
Continue with .

term.guimenu: Only create SAP HANA file systems, do not install SAP products now

listitem.para: Create an &hana; file system on &b1;-certified hardware.
listitem.remark: Create a procedure for HANA fs creation? It just does stuff and you can't do much anyway. - sknorr, 2016-01-28

important.title: Hardware Requirements
important.para: Make sure your machine fulfills the hardware requirements for &hana; detailed in . Otherwise, this option will not create a new file system and the installation workflow ends at this point.

term.guimenu: Finish wizard and proceed to OS login

listitem.para: Do not install an &sap; application and continue to the login screen of &sles4sap;.

step.para: Proceed with Next.

sect1.title: Using the &sapwiz;
sect1.para: Use the &sapwiz; to install an &netweaver; system (including database) or an &hana; system.

tip.title: Installing an &sap; Application in a Fully Installed System
tip.para: To start the &sapin;, from the desktop, choose ApplicationsSystem YaST, continue in the &yast; control center by choosing Miscellaneous SAP Installation Wizard.

tip.title: &sapwiz; Configuration
tip.remark: Terminology: "SAP Installer"/"SAPinst" and "SAP Installation Wizard" are pretty close. Maybe SUSE should change the wizard's name some time in the future..? - sknorr, 2016-01-15
tip.para: The &sapwiz; configuration is specified and documented in /etc/sysconfig/sap-installation-wizard. You can change it according to your needs.

step.para: In the screen SAP Installation Wizard, provide the Location of the SAP Installation Master (). The location can either be a local, removable, or remote installation source.
Select the appropriate option from the drop-down box. In the text box, specify the path to your source according to the format given in the following table.

tip.title: Remote Location Specification
tip.para: To install from an NFS source, specify the name of the server and the complete path to the media data. For information about setting up a remote installation server, see .

step.para: If you have installed an &sap; application from an installation server before or set up your system to be an installation server, you can also directly choose that server as the provider of the &instmaster;. To do so, use the drop-down box below Choose an installation master.
Under Advanced Options, choose from the following options:

term.guimenu: Collect installation profiles for SAP products but do not execute installation

listitem.para: Use this option to set the installation parameters, but not perform the actual installation. With this option, the &sapin; (&sapina;) will stop without performing the actual &sap; product installation. However, the steps that follow fully apply.
For more information, see .

term.guimenu: Serve all installation media (including master) to local network via NFS

listitem.para: Set up this system as an installation server for other &sles4sap; systems. The media copied to this installation server will be offered through NFS and can be discovered via Service Location Protocol (SLP).

step.para: Proceed with Next.
The &sapwiz; will now copy the &instmaster; to your local disk. Depending on the type of &instmaster; you selected, the installation will continue differently:

listitem.para: If you are installing an &hana; database, skip ahead to .
If you are installing an &netweaver; application, continue with the next step.

step.para: On the screen SAP Installation Wizard, provide the location of additional &instmedia; you want to install. This can include an &sap; kernel, a database, and database exports.

listitem.para: Specify a path to additional &instmedia;. For more information about specifying the path, see .
Do not copy additional &instmedia;. Choose this option if you do not need additional &instmedia; or to install additional &instmedia; directly from their source, for example CDs/DVDs or flash disks.
When choosing this option despite your &sap; product requiring additional &instmedia;, you will later need to provide the &sapin; (&sapina;) with the relevant paths.

step.para: Proceed with Next.
If you chose to copy &instmedia;, the &sapwiz; will copy the relevant files to your local hard disk.
After copying the &instmedia;, you will be asked whether you want to prepare additional &instmedia;. To do so, click Yes. Then follow the instructions in .
Otherwise, click No.
In the screen What Would You Like to Install, under The SAP product is, choose how you want to install the product:

listitem.para: Install an &sap; application including its database.
Engines that add functionality to a standard product: &sap; TREX, &sap; Gateway, and Web Dispatcher.
An &sap; application that is separated onto multiple servers.
Installation of &netweaver; in a high-availability setup.

Allows changing the various system properties such as the &sap; system ID, database ID, instance number, or host name. This can be used to install the same product in a very similar configuration on different systems.

step.para: If you selected SAP Standard System, Distributed System, or SAP High-Availability System, additionally choose a back-end database under The back-end database system is.
Proceed with Next.
You will now see the screen Choose a Product. The products shown depend on the &mediaset; and &instmaster; you received from &sap;. From the list, select the product you want to install.
Proceed with Next.
You will be asked whether to copy &supmedia; or &thirdmedia;. To do so, click Yes and then follow the instructions in .
Otherwise, click No.

note.title: Difference Between &supmedia;/&thirdmedia; and Additional Software Repositories

listitem.para: &supmedia;/&thirdmedia; is installed using an &ay; file which allows creating an installation wizard and custom installation scripts.

step.para: For information on creating &supmedia;, see .

On the screen Additional software repositories for your SAP installation, you can add further software repositories. For example, for add-ons that are packaged as RPM. To do so, click Add new software repositories. For more information about adding repositories, see &deploy;, Chapter Installing and Removing Software, Section Adding Software Repositories (&docaddress;).
Proceed with Next.

note.title: Location of Copied &sap; Media
note.para: At this point, all data required for the &sap; installation has been copied to /data/SAP_CDs (unless you chose to skip the process of copying). Each Installation Medium is copied to a separate directory. You might find the following directory structure, for example:
/data/SAP_CDs is the default directory as specified in the /etc/sysconfig/sap-installation-wizard configuration file.

step.para: Depending on the product you are installing, one or more dialogs will prompt you to supply values for several configuration parameters for the &sap; application you are installing.
Supply the values as described in the documentation provided to you by &sap;. Help for the configuration parameters is also available on the left side of the dialog. For more information, see .
Fill out the form (or forms), then proceed with OK.
When you are done, the &sapwiz; will download additional software packages.

When installing &hana; on a system that is not certified for &hana; and does not meet the minimum hardware requirements for &hana; TDI (Tailored Datacenter Integration), you will be asked whether to continue. If you receive this message unexpectedly, check and the sizing guidelines from &sap; at .
Otherwise, continue with Yes.
The following steps differ depending on the type of &sap; application you are installing:

listitem.para: When installing an &hana; database, &hana; will now be installed without further question.
Follow the &sapin; as described in the documentation provided by &sap;. Most configuration parameters are correctly filled already.

tip.title: Installation Log Files
tip.para: If the installation of the &sap; application fails, refer to the installation log files. They are located in /var/adm/autoinstall. Failed installations are recorded in files with names ending in .err.
For more information about log files, see .

step.para: The final screen is Installation Completed.
To create an &ay; file for this installation, activate Clone This System for AutoYaST. The &ay; file will be placed in /root/autoinst.xml.
Click Finish.

sect1.title: Continuing an Installation Using an Installation Profile
sect1.para: If you chose Collect installation profiles but do not execute installation during the previous run of the &sapwiz;, this section will show you how to continue the installation of the selected &sap; applications.
When collecting an installation profile, the &sapwiz; copies product images to /data/SAP_CDs. It also prepares an installation environment for every product under the path /data/SAP_INST:
These files are re-used in the following. To continue the installation, follow these steps:

step.para: In /etc/sysconfig/sap-installation-wizard, set the following:
In the case of an &hana;/&b1; installation, the &sapwiz; will later use the parameters documented in the &ay; files in /data/SAP_INST/number.
If you need to change any parameters, make sure to adapt the &ay; files at this point.
Open the &yast; control center and start SAP Installation Wizard.

step.remark: This question appears whether SAP_AUTO_INSTALL is yes or not. However, if not, all questions will be asked again. There seems to be partial state at least, in that the installer remembers what is already copied. Bug or working as intended? - sknorr, 2016-02-03
step.para: You will be asked whether to continue the pending installation. Select Install.
All further interactions happen within the &sapin;. Follow the steps of &sapin; as described in the documentation provided to you by &sap;.

listitem.para: In the case of an &netweaver; installation, all parameters of the &sapin; will be offered again for fine-tuning.
In the case of an &hana;/&b1; installation, the installer will not be offering to make any changes to parameters.

sect2.title: &nw; Installation
sect2.para: For &netweaver;, the following example shows how the installation can be automated. Specifically, this example is tailored to installing ASCS Instance of an &nw; 7.5 ABAP Server distributed system with MaxDB (product ID NW_ABAP_ASCS:NW750.ADA.ABAP). When installing other products based on &nw;, not all of the following variables may be necessary or these variables might need to be replaced by others:

listitem.para: The master password for the &nw; instance: MASTER_PASSWORD
The &sap; Identifier (SID): SID
The &sap; kernel: KERNEL
The &sap; instance number: INSTANCE_NUMBER
The ASCS virtual host name: ASCS_VIRTUAL_HOSTNAME
The SCS virtual host name: SCS_VIRTUAL_HOSTNAME
